headline: Food Giants Are Struggling. Could Mergers, Spinoffs, and Activist Stakes Help?
summary: The industry behemoths are scrambling to adapt—through mergers, acquisitions, spinoffs, and asset sales.  Constellation Brands  —maker of Mexican beers Corona and Modelo—suffered a steep stock slide on Tuesday after it sharply reduced fiscal‑2026 guidance.  CEO Bill Newlands blamed broader macroeconomic softness and notably weaker spending among Hispanic consumers—a core demographic for its premium beers.

content.title: Food Giants Are Struggling. Could Mergers, Spinoffs, and Activist Stakes Help?
content.summary: The industry behemoths are scrambling to adapt—through mergers, acquisitions, spinoffs, and asset sales.  Constellation Brands  —maker of Mexican beers Corona and Modelo—suffered a steep stock slide on Tuesday after it sharply reduced fiscal‑2026 guidance.  CEO Bill Newlands blamed broader macroeconomic softness and notably weaker spending among Hispanic consumers—a core demographic for its premium beers.

headline: Constellation Brands Stock Slumps. Why It Slashed Guidance.
summary: FEATURE  Shares of Constellation Brands sank Tuesday after the parent of the Corona and Modelo brands slashed its fiscal-year outlook, citing weaker consumer demand for beer.  Constellation Brands forecasts organic net sales to fall 4% to 6% fiscal 2026, compared to a previous range of down 2% to up 1%.

content.title: Constellation Brands Stock Slumps. Why It Slashed Guidance.
content.summary: FEATURE  Shares of Constellation Brands sank Tuesday after the parent of the Corona and Modelo brands slashed its fiscal-year outlook, citing weaker consumer demand for beer.  Constellation Brands forecasts organic net sales to fall 4% to 6% fiscal 2026, compared to a previous range of down 2% to up 1%.

headline: Constellation Brands (STZ) Completes US$604 Million Share Buyback
summary: Constellation Brands (STZ) experienced a 2% price increase last week as it updated investors on a recent share repurchase tranche. The company bought back nearly 1.77 million shares, accounting for about 1% of its total shares, at a cost of $298 million. This update may have bolstered investor confidence, contributing positively against broader market volatility. Amidst sharp declines across tech stocks and macroeconomic uncertainty affecting indices like the Dow and S&P 500, Constellation's...

headline: Why Celsius (CELH) Stock Is Down Today
summary: Shares of energy drink company Celsius (NASDAQ:CELH) fell 3.4% in the morning session after peer beverage company Constellation Brands (STZ) revised its fiscal 2026 outlook downward, citing challenging macroeconomic conditions. Constellation Brands updated its comparable earnings per share guidance to a range of $11.30-$11.60, a significant drop from its previous forecast of $12.60-$12.90, and now expects an organic net sales decline. headline: Why Constellation Brands (STZ) Shares Are Plunging Today
summary: Shares of beer, wine, and spirits company Constellation Brands (NYSE:STZ) fell 7.4% in the morning session after the company lowered its financial outlook for fiscal year 2026, citing a challenging macroeconomic environment and weakening consumer demand. The owner of popular brands like Corona and Modelo now projects comparable earnings per share of $11.30 to $11.60, a significant reduction from the prior forecast of $12.60 to $12.90. The owner of popular brands like Corona and Modelo now projects comparable earnings per share of $11.30 to $11.60, a significant reduction from the prior forecast of $12.60 to $12.90. headline: Modelo seller Constellation Brands lowers sales forecast as US consumers buy less beer
summary: Constellation Brands, which owns the Modelo and Corona beers in the U.S., lowered its full-year sales and profit outlook Tuesday, citing falling demand among Hispanic customers in particular.  Constellation President and CEO Bill Newlands said U.S. purchases of high-end beers have declined over the past few months.  Consumers are making fewer trips to buy beer and are spending less per trip, Newlands said.

content.title: Modelo seller Constellation Brands lowers sales forecast as US consumers buy less beer
content.summary: Constellation Brands, which owns the Modelo and Corona beers in the U.S., lowered its full-year sales and profit outlook Tuesday, citing falling demand among Hispanic customers in particular.  Constellation President and CEO Bill Newlands said U.S. purchases of high-end beers have declined over the past few months.  Consumers are making fewer trips to buy beer and are spending less per trip, Newlands said.
